  "description": "The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) works worldwide to provide protection and humanitarian assistance to people affected by conflict and armed violence. We are an independent and neutral organization, and our mandate stems essentially from the Geneva Conventions of 1949. We work closely with National Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies and with their International Federation in order to ensure a concerted, rational and rapid humanitarian response to the needs of the victims of armed conflict or any other situation of internal violence. We direct and coordinate the international activities conducted in these situations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Medical Warehouse Quality Assurance Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

The Purpose


	Under the supervision of the Pharmacist, the Medical Warehouse Quality Assurance Officer supports the implementation of defined medical quality assurance tasks, specific procedures or instructions related to medical warehouse activities, ensuring compliance with the good storage and distribution practices (GSDP) of the World Health Organization (WHO).
	S/he is also responsible for the quality control of incoming medical goods.


Your Role


	Closely supervises physical inspections and performs quality control of purchased and received medical items, files complaints if needed, and keeps collected samples up to date for reference purposes.
	Follow up on regulatory protocols linked to reception of medical items at the warehouse.
	Supports warehouse staff in creating supplier complaints and recording deviations, participates in investigating deviations (including inventory discrepancies) and customer complaints, and helps identify and implement corrective and preventive action (CAPA).
	Facilitates continuous compliance by the medical warehouse with the WHO&rsquo;s GSDP with respect to the risk of mix-ups, segregation of items requiring specific management (e.g. narcotics, hazardous substances), and environmental controls (e.g. routine temperature monitoring, cleaning, pest control).
	Prepares periodic quality reports related to warehouse activities, including routine temperature monitoring, cleaning, pest control, deviations, complaints, and all quality-related information needed by the Pharmacist to prepare the annual quality review.
	Ensures that outsourced activity schedules are respected (e.g. maintenance and calibration of equipment, pest control).
	Supports the management of controlled drugs in the warehouse and the disposal of medical products.
	Ensures the timely recording of specific information (e.g. temperature data, cold chain breakdown).
	Facilitates and/or provides relevant training to warehouse staff.
	Any other responsibilities assigned by manager.


Your profile: Education &amp; Experience


	University Degree with specialization in quality management systems (pharmacy-related), a pharmacy degree certificate.
	3 years of experience as a pharmacist or quality representative in a pharmaceutical manufacturing/distribution company.
	Experience as a quality control officer in a pharmaceutical warehouse an asset
	Computer proficiency (Microsoft Office). Knowledge of enterprise resource planning software an asset.
	Fluent command of English. Knowledge of the local language an asset.
	Applicant must have a valid working permit to work in Nigeria.


What We Offer


	Rewarding work in a humanitarian and multicultural environment.
	Competitive employment package with medical insurance and ICRC pension plan.
	In-house training opportunities for personal development.
	A full-time, Fixed-term contract (1year renewable).
	The opportunity to join an ICRC talent pool, be considered for future assignments elsewhere and experience different contexts, fields, and challenges.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should:&nbsp;Click here to apply online
And
Send&nbsp;your resume and a cover letter, valid license to practice (where relevant), and a valid ID card to&nbsp;ABJ_Recruitment_Services@icrc.org&nbsp;clearly indicate &ldquo;ABJ202500547 Medical WHS Quality AO ABJ&quot;&nbsp;as the subject of your application.

Note


	Only applications submitted through the designated MS Form will be considered for this role
	Late applications will not be considered. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.
	Equal opportunities shall be provided to all employees and applicants for employment based on their demonstrated ability and competence without discrimination based on race, colour, religion, gender, nationality, status, disability etc. (The ICRC values diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive working environment).
	We welcome applications from all qualified candidates;Female &amp;People Living with Disability applicants are encouraged to apply.
	ICRC will not request any monetary payments from applicants at any stage of the recruitment process.

Medical Warehouse Quality Assurance Officer Job at International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC)




        
    

        
        The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) works worldwide to provide protection and humanitarian assistance to people affected by conflict and armed violence. We take action in response to emergencies and at the same time promote respect for international humanitarian law. We are an independent and neutral organization, and our mandate stems essentially from the Geneva Conventions of 1949. We work closely with National Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies and with their International Federation in order to ensure a concerted, rational and rapid humanitarian response to the needs of the victims of armed conflict or any other situation of internal violence. We direct and coordinate the international activities conducted in these situations.

Job Position: Medical Warehouse Quality Assurance Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

The Purpose


	Under the supervision of the Pharmacist, the Medical Warehouse Quality Assurance Officer supports the implementation of defined medical quality assurance tasks, specific procedures or instructions related to medical warehouse activities, ensuring compliance with the good storage and distribution practices (GSDP) of the World Health Organization (WHO).
	S/he is also responsible for the quality control of incoming medical goods.


Your Role


	Closely supervises physical inspections and performs quality control of purchased and received medical items, files complaints if needed, and keeps collected samples up to date for reference purposes.
	Follow up on regulatory protocols linked to reception of medical items at the warehouse.
	Supports warehouse staff in creating supplier complaints and recording deviations, participates in investigating deviations (including inventory discrepancies) and customer complaints, and helps identify and implement corrective and preventive action (CAPA).
	Facilitates continuous compliance by the medical warehouse with the WHO’s GSDP with respect to the risk of mix-ups, segregation of items requiring specific management (e.g. narcotics, hazardous substances), and environmental controls (e.g. routine temperature monitoring, cleaning, pest control).
	Prepares periodic quality reports related to warehouse activities, including routine temperature monitoring, cleaning, pest control, deviations, complaints, and all quality-related information needed by the Pharmacist to prepare the annual quality review.
	Ensures that outsourced activity schedules are respected (e.g. maintenance and calibration of equipment, pest control).
	Supports the management of controlled drugs in the warehouse and the disposal of medical products.
	Ensures the timely recording of specific information (e.g. temperature data, cold chain breakdown).
	Facilitates and/or provides relevant training to warehouse staff.
	Any other responsibilities assigned by manager.


Your profile: Education & Experience


	University Degree with specialization in quality management systems (pharmacy-related), a pharmacy degree certificate.
	3 years of experience as a pharmacist or quality representative in a pharmaceutical manufacturing/distribution company.
	Experience as a quality control officer in a pharmaceutical warehouse an asset
	Computer proficiency (Microsoft Office). Knowledge of enterprise resource planning software an asset.
	Fluent command of English. Knowledge of the local language an asset.
	Applicant must have a valid working permit to work in Nigeria.


What We Offer


	Rewarding work in a humanitarian and multicultural environment.
	Competitive employment package with medical insurance and ICRC pension plan.
	In-house training opportunities for personal development.
	A full-time, Fixed-term contract (1year renewable).
	The opportunity to join an ICRC talent pool, be considered for future assignments elsewhere and experience different contexts, fields, and challenges.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should: Click here to apply online
And
Send your resume and a cover letter, valid license to practice (where relevant), and a valid ID card to ABJ_Recruitment_Services@icrc.org clearly indicate “ABJ202500547 Medical WHS Quality AO ABJ" as the subject of your application.

Note


	Only applications submitted through the designated MS Form will be considered for this role
	Late applications will not be considered. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.
	Equal opportunities shall be provided to all employees and applicants for employment based on their demonstrated ability and competence without discrimination based on race, colour, religion, gender, nationality, status, disability etc. (The ICRC values diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive working environment).
	We welcome applications from all qualified candidates;Female &People Living with Disability applicants are encouraged to apply.
	ICRC will not request any monetary payments from applicants at any stage of the recruitment process.

Farm Manager - Poultry Job at Olam Agri




        
    

        
        Olam Agri is a market-leading, differentiated food, feed, and fiber agri-business with a global origination footprint, processing capabilities, and deep understanding of market needs built over 33 years. With a strong presence in high-growth emerging markets and products across grains & oilseeds, animal feed & protein, rice, edible oils, specialty grains & seeds, cotton, wood products, rubber and commodity financial services.

Olam Agri is at the heart of global food and agri-trade flows with more than 40 million MT in volume traded annually. Focused on transforming food, feed and fiber for a more sustainable future, it aims at creating value for customers, enabling farming communities to prosper sustainably, and strive for a food-secure future.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Farm Manager - Poultry

Job Location: Kaduna

Job Description


	Lead and manage Layer and Broiler Breeder operations, utilizing ultra-modern and automated systems (e.g., closed houses, tunnel ventilation, automatic feeding, automatic egg collection systems) with minimal human intervention.
	Oversee farms to ensure adherence to best-in-class international industry norms.
	Recruit, develop, and train team members, establishing and implementing best practices for brooding and growing, vaccination, health, biosecurity measures, and the performance of broiler parent stock (PS) flocks.
	Develop and implement protocols for body weight and flock uniformity, vaccination, health, biosecurity, labor sanitation practices, feeding, and preventive medication. Create formats for measuring performance parameters.
	Improve project infrastructure to enable efficient utilization of facilities/resources and achieve strong performance with low operating costs.
	Implement and maintain exceptionally high international biosecurity standards.
	Develop reporting formats and conduct regular performance reviews for team members.
	Achieve targets for mortalities, flock uniformity, egg production, Hatching Eggs per hen housed (HE/HH), and reduce the cost of hatching egg production.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Veterinary Sciences / Agriculture Science (Animal Production) or Post-graduation in Veterinary Sciences with a specialization in Poultry Production/Pathology.
	15 - 20 years of experience across diverse markets, including regions with high levels of automation in closed houses and developing regions (Africa experience preferred). This blend of experience is essential for achieving developed-world standards in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Technology Sales Executive

	We are looking for an accomplished&nbsp;Senior Technology Sales Executive&nbsp;with 8&ndash;10 years of experience driving enterprise sales in&nbsp;cybersecurity, cloud computing, automation, and AI solutions. The ideal professional combines strategic business acumen with hands-on consultative selling skills and a strong ability to engage&nbsp;C-level executives. This individual should have a consistent record of closing&nbsp;complex, high-value enterprise deals, and positioning advanced technology as a catalyst for business transformation.

	Consistently meet or surpass assigned quarterly and annual revenue goals.
	Develop and secure new enterprise clients while deepening relationships with existing accounts.
	Build trusted partnerships with&nbsp;C-suite leaders&nbsp;(CIOs, CTOs, CISOs, CFOs, etc.) across industries.
	Articulate how cybersecurity, cloud, automation, and AI solutions create measurable business value.
	Partner with technical presales, OEM vendors, and delivery teams to craft compelling proposals.
	Keep informed of&nbsp;market dynamics, competitor strategies, and technology innovations to refine go-to-market plans.
	Maintain accurate&nbsp;sales pipeline, forecasts, and CRM records.
	Strengthen sales opportunities through co-selling with OEMs, distributors, and channel partners.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business, IT, or related discipline (MBA is an advantage).
	8&ndash;10 years of enterprise technology sales experience across&nbsp;cybersecurity, cloud, automation, or AI domains.&nbsp;(6+ years can be considered if applicant can proove competence)
	Demonstrated history of exceeding&nbsp;multi-million-dollar sales targets.
	Strong understanding of&nbsp;enterprise procurement cycles&nbsp;and decision-making processes.
	Existing network of&nbsp;executive-level contacts&nbsp;in key sectors such as finance, telecoms, energy, manufacturing, and public sector.

Core Competencies


	Consultative and&nbsp;value-based selling

	Self-motivated, energetic, and performance-driven
	Leadership mindset with capacity to&nbsp;coach and mentor&nbsp;team members


Key Metrics for Success (KPIs)


	Achievement of revenue and quota targets
	Acquisition of new enterprise clients
	Expansion of existing accounts through&nbsp;cross-sell and upsell initiatives
	Win rate on strategic or large-scale opportunities

	Client retention and satisfaction
